intro: Cephaloschefflera apoensis, commonly known as the Philippine umbrella tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Sphaeranthaceae and is characterized by its dense, umbrella-like canopy of small, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by bright red or orange berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is also cultivated as a houseplant in tropical and subtropical regions.
